Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 2 (Original U.K. Edition)
Maggie Smith  (Actor),     Hugh Bonneville  (Actor),     Julian Fellowes  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
['Product Description', 'Season 2 of the Emmy® Award-winning Downton Abbey returns as The Great War rages across Europe, and not even the serene Yorkshire countryside is free from its effects. The men and women of Downton are doing their part both on the front lines and the home front, but the intensity of war only serves to inflame the more familiar passionslove, loss, blackmail, and betrayal.', 'Review', '...it remains a glorious, escapist entertainment which, as the fabric of society is torn asunder, the economy crashes around our ears and the autumnal rain lashes down, should at least keep us distracted until Christmas. --Andrew Pettie, The TelegraphSex, blackmail, girls in nice frocks and now a war. Downton Abbey just got even better. --Sam Wollaston, The Guardian']

Okay, I resisted Downton for three seasons, thinking it would be too 'PBS" for me.  Then a friend put it on while I was there and i was hooked.  Already devoured season 3 and can't understand why they don't make more episodes faster.
Hooked!
Doubt
Meryl Streep  (Actor),     Philip Seymour Hoffman  (Actor),     John Patrick Shanley  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Miramax Home Entertainment, All Titles
['Product Description', 'From Miramax Films comes one of the most honored and acclaimed motion pictures of the year, Doubt. Based on the Pulitzer Prize and Tony Award-winning play, Doubt is a mesmerizing, suspense-filled drama with four riveting performances from Meryl Streep, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Amy Adams and Viola Davis that will have you pinned to the edge of your seat. Sister Aloysius Beauvier (Streep), the rigid and fear-inspiring principal of the Saint Nicholas Church School, suffers an extreme dislike for the progressive and popular parish priest Father Flynn (Hoffman). Looking for wrongdoing in every corner, Sister Aloysius believes she\'s uncovered the ultimate sin when she hears Father Flynn has taken a special interest in a troubled boy. But without proof, the only thing certain is doubt."One of the best pictures of the year," (USA Today, Rolling Stone, New York Post, San Francisco Examiner, Roger Ebert).Bonus Features include From Stage To Screen, Scoring Doubt, The Sisters Of Charity', 'Amazon.com', "It's always a risk when writers direct their own work, since some playwrights don't travel well from stage to screen. Aided by Roger Deakins, of", 'No Country for Old Men', 'fame, who vividly captures the look of a blustery Bronx winter,', 'Moonstruck', "'s John Patrick Shanley pulls it off. If", 'Doubt', 'makes for a dialogue-heavy experience, like', 'The Crucible', 'and', '12 Angry Men', ", the words and ideas are never dull, and a consummate cast makes each one count. Set in 1964 and loosely inspired by actual events, Shanley focuses on St. Nicholas, a Catholic primary school that has accepted its first African-American student, Donald Miller (Joseph Foster), who serves as altar boy to the warm-hearted Father Flynn (Phillip Seymour Hoffman). Donald may not have any friends, but that doesn't worry his mother, Mrs. Miller (Viola Davis in a scene-stealing performance), since her sole concern is that her son gets a good education. When Sister James (Amy Adams) notices Flynn concentrating more of his attentions on Miller than the other boys, she mentions the matter to Sister Aloysius Beauvier (Meryl Streep), the school's hard-nosed principal. Looking for any excuse to push the progressive priest out of her tradition-minded institution, Sister Aloysius sets out to destroy him, and if that means ruining Donald's future in the process--so be it. Naturally, she's the least sympathetic combatant in this battle, but Streep invests her disciplinarian with wit and unexpected flashes of empathy. Of all the characters she's played, Sister Aloysius comes closest to caricature, but she never feels like a cartoon; just a sad woman willing to do anything to hold onto what little she has before the forces of change render her--and everything she represents--redundant.", '--Kathleen C. Fennessy', 'Stills from', 'Doubt', '(Click for larger image)', 'Review', "Nominated for 5 Academy Awards, including Meryl Streep's record-setting 15th Oscar nomination (Best Performance by an Actress), Doubt continues to wow audiences and critics alike.2009 Academy AwardsNominated Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role Philip Seymour HoffmanNominated Best Performance by an Waltons: Season 2
Richard Thomas  (Actor),     Ralph Waite  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
['Waltons, The: The Complete Second Season (Repackage/Stack Hub)', 'Enduring another hard year of the Depression, the Walton family remembers that the true richness of life comes from the joy, love and compassion they bring one another. John-Boy’s (Richard Thomas) parents, John (Ralph Waite) and Olivia (Michael Learned), and grandparents (Will Geer, Ellen Corby) set sterling examples of strength and determination for the generations to follow. In the second season, Thanksgiving joy turns to worry when John-Boy suffers a head injury, and Grandma Walton inherits some money — and a host of problems. Plus, John-Boy makes the family proud as he graduates from high school, and a corporation offers John a modest fortune to sell Walton’s Mountain. Will he do it? Sissy Spacek, John Ritter and Ron Howard guest star in this heartwarming, classic series.', ']]>']

Waltons: Season 3
Richard Thomas  (Actor),     Ralph Waite  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
['Waltons, The: The Complete Third Season (Repackage/Stack Hub)', 'In Season Three, John-Boy heads off to college – and life will never be the same on Walton’s Mountain. When scholarship winner John-Boy enters Boatwright University, Jason takes his big brother’s place as head kid wrangler for the Walton brood while finding his own identity in music. And while John and Olivia celebrate twenty years of marriage, Grandpa and Grandma leave home (but return). Change has come to Walton’s Mountain. But one thing will never change: the powerful family bond that keeps the Waltons forever together. Both topical and timeless, the third season sees the Waltons facing the age-old issues of family: holding children close and letting them go, doing without and making do.', ']]>']

What can I say?  I'm a fan of the early years of the Waltons, and absolutely hate the later years when major cast members jumped ship.  Still mad a Richard Thomas for not coming back for a few episodes in the last season (John Boy, war has changed you!).  Anyway, these can be put on the TV any time, in any order, and be enjoyed by the whole family, with the exception of the teenage daughter who thinks they are lame.  But, she thinks practically everything is lame, so her opinion her is probably also lame.  PS.  I have season 1 & 2 also, and enjoy them every bit as much.
and absolutely hate the later years when major cast members jumped ship
Spencer's Mountain (DVD)
Maureen O'Hara  (Actor),     Henry Fonda  (Actor),     Delmer Daves  (Director, Producer, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family
['Product Description', "Spencer's Mountain (DVD)", 'Academy Award winner Henry Fonda stars with Maureen O\'Hara as thepatriarch of a rural West Virginia family, a family that lives andstrives for a better life on the slopes of Spencer\'s Mountain.ClaySpencer (Fonda--On Golden Pond, 12 Angry Men) and his wife, Olivia(O\'Hara--The Parent Trap), have worked hard to rear their nine children.And they are filled with pride when their eldest son, Clayboy (JamesMacArthur--Swiss Family Robinson, "Hawaii Five-O"), graduates from highschool at the head of his class and dreams of being the first Spencer togo to college. But, even though Clay is the best employee at the localmill, there isn\'t enough money to pay for Clayboy\'s tuition at theuniversity. Now, the entire family will work hard, suffer and sacrificehopes to help the Clayboy live his dream in this classic family film.', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', 'Long before Henry Fonda played an irascible patriarch in', 'On Golden Pond', ', he played an equally crusty family man in this warmly rustic, 1963 drama', "Spencer's Mountain", ', based on an Earl Hamner Jr. novel that later inspired the television series', 'The Waltons', '. Fonda plays Clay Spencer, a fiercely independent, hard-drinking, foul-mouthed Wyoming laborer who believes in God but rejects (to his tiny community\'s consternation) organized religion. Scraping together enough money to build a new house for his wife (Maureen O\'Hara) and nine children, Spencer runs into an obstacle to both his plans and family pride when his college-bound son (James MacArthur) romances the daughter of Spencer\'s boss. Director Delmer Daves whips up a kind of morose schmaltz out of the earnest material, but it\'s Fonda\'s grit and heartland integrity that carry the day and establish some self-effacing wit. Some nice features here, including interviews with Fonda and a short documentary, "Spencer\'s Mountain: Grand Teton Premiere."', '--Tom Keogh']
{'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Drama', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': "Wally Cox, James Mac Arthur, Donald Crisp, Delmer Daves, Maureen O'Hara, Henry Fonda", 'Initial release date': '2005-02-08', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), Unqualified', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.77:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '2289677', 'Director': 'Delmer Daves', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 58 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 8, 2005', 'Actors': "Maureen O'Hara, Henry Fonda, James Mac Arthur, Donald Crisp, Wally Cox", 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Producers': 'Delmer Daves', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Writers': 'Delmer Daves', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
From here came the Waltons.  This is not the Waltons.  Takes place out west somewhere.  And with the exception of Olivia, all the names are changed.  Still, has a comfortable feel.  Pretty good story, based, apparently on the original novel (which I have a copy of around here somewhere and am meaning to read one of these days;  so many books, so little time!).  Good bunch of actors playing the main roles; faces you know from lots of other movies of this time period.  I like movies like this on in the background of my workshop rather than the radio.  Soothing.
has a comfortable feel. Pretty good story

Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, Live Action, All Titles
['You\'re in for a devil of a time when three outlandishly wild witches -- Bette Midler (BEACHES, BIG BUSINESS), Sarah Jessica Parker (HONEYMOON IN VEGAS), and Kathy Najimy (SISTER ACT) -- return from 17th-century Salem after they\'re accidentally conjured up by some unsuspecting pranksters! It\'s a night full of zany fun and comic chaos once the tricky 300-year-old trio sets out to cast a spell on the town and reclaim their youth -- but first they must get their act together and outwit three kids and a talking cat! Loaded with bewitching laughs, HOCUS POCUS is an outrageously wild comedy that\'s sure to entertain everyone!|Producer David Kirschner came up with the idea for the movie one night while he and his young daughter were sitting outside and his neighbor\'s black cat strayed by. Kirschner began to unspool a narrative of how the cat was once a boy who was changed into a feline 300 years ago by three witches.|Actress Kathy Najimy described her character Mary as "Eddie Haskell as a witch," referring to the character on the classic TV series "Leave It To Beaver." "She sucks up to Winifred [Bette Midler\'s character] every chance she gets. She wants to be part of the power club and Winifred\'s got the power."|To create the costumes, designer Mary Vogt read many historical books about Salem, Massachusetts. "I even read diaries of women who were hanged as witches," she says.']

Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
["The worldwide phenomenon comes to life in Fifty Shades of Grey, starring Dakota Johnson and Jamie Dornan in the iconic roles of Anastasia Steele and Christian Grey. Ana is an inexperienced college student tasked with interviewing enigmatic billionaire Christian Grey. But what starts as business quickly becomes an unconventional romance. Swept up in Christian's glamorous lifestyle, Ana soon finds another side to him as she discovers his secrets and explores her own dark desires. What results is a thrilling, all-consuming romance as Christian and Ana test the limits they will go to for their relationship.", 'Bonus Content:', 'The World of Fifty Shades of Grey: Friends and Family', 'The World of Fifty Shades of Grey: Friends and Family', 'Behind the Shades', 'Behind the Shades', ']]>']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Media Preferences:** The user continues to demonstrate a strong interest in drama series and films featuring complex themes, particularly those that address historical contexts linked to organized religion and societal issues. They maintain a fondness for nostalgic family dramas that promote moral integrity and community values, while also increasing their appreciation for action films, especially within familiar franchises. They enjoy classic films and comedies but are also open to risqué content, as evidenced by recent explorations into more mature themes.

- **Content Style:** They gravitate towards emotionally and intellectually engaging storytelling that delves into moral dilemmas and family dynamics, yet they are also receptive to lighter, mainstream narratives, including family-oriented comedies.

- **Platform Affinity:** The user has a keen fondness for PBS programming, particularly British series and classic television, along with Hallmark content that focuses on family-oriented storytelling.

- **Viewing Behavior:** They exhibit caution towards new shows or films, but become highly engaged when captivated. Their interest in popular family comedies and action series is growing, along with a newly reinforced appreciation for classic dramas.

- **Community Influence:** Recommendations from friends and family heavily shape their viewing choices, as they value shared experiences.

- **Emotional Connection:** The user seeks entertainment that serves as both a distraction and a reflection on moral and familial themes.

- **Rating Tendency:** They rate content based on personal resonance, favoring films that bring joy and nostalgia to family members, highlighting a preference for character-driven narratives.
